snippet: The F.C.C.’s new plan leans toward creating a two-tiered system that could discriminate against smaller companies and restrict consumer choice.
abstract: Editorial analyzes new plan put forward by Federal Communications Commission after weeks of criticism over agency's previous proposal for dividing the Internet; notes that plan still seems to be leaning toward creating two-tiered system that could discriminate against smaller companies and restrict consumer choice; urges commission to take its time finessing plan, saying rules are too important to rush through.
lead_paragraph: The F.C.C.’s new plan leans toward creating a two-tiered system that could discriminate against smaller companies and restrict consumer choice.

headline.main: Searching for Fairness on the Internet
headline.print_headline: Searching for Fairness on the Internet
